comment: Easy class, you dont really have to show up but on random days he does take attendance. Class is short and so are his PowerPoints. There are two test midterm and final. They both are simple question and if you study the PowerPoints youll get an A.

Professor Gardner is super easy. He goes through the slide and then posts them on D2L. I skipped the last month of the semester and only came on the day of the final and still received an A in the class, and many students can say the same. He has 2 tests: A midterm and Final Exam. Both aRe multiple choice and True/ False. Also NO TEXTBOOK!
Easy professor! No textbook needed. All notes (PP) online. midterm(45%), final(45%), and participation(10%) doesnt care if you come to class or not. average midterm grade is an 88%

If you don't pass his class it's because you were lazy. Notes were posted online and test are strictly from the power points. We didn't have many grades and he doesnt care much if you show up to class, but if you dont then you may miss some things. I'd suggest you take him, especially if this isn't your subject!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Only 3 grades. Midterm, final, and 10% participation. Tests are straight from lectures, and are really easy if you know the material on the powerpoints. No homework or textbook. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Not much to say other than that he talks somewhat quietly, so be ready to listen up. He simply explains everything on the powerpoints, which is all the info you will need for the tests. Also, I did not use the textbook at all; it's still in its plastic wrapping. I would ask his previous students if they ever opened their books to save money.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Three grades. Midterm, Final, and participation. The material covered in class is confusing and incomplete, you are expected to look up definitions on your own time. I got a C in the class and I think I deserved an A for the amount of studying I did. He provides powerpoints but they are unclear.

Three grades. Midterm, Final, and participation. The material covered in class is confusing and incomplete, you are expected to look up definitions on your own time. I got a C in the class and I think I deserved an A for the amount of studying I did.
I made a painful B, an 89. Easy class anyway
He only gives a midterm and a final. Both exams are straight from the power points that he lectures from. If you go to class or review the power points he posts online you will most likely get an A.

Great teacher, overall is very knowledgeable about what he is talking about. you have 2 free absences. Test are very easy as long as you study the slides. He is a very cool and laid back professor. As long as you do the work that is required and study, you should do just fine.
